subcategories.name: Operating Theater
subcategories.description: More safety in the operating room - this is the goal pursued by HARTMANN with its products for the operating room. Here safety mainly means the prevention of contamination using suitable drapes and gowns and the further development of dressing materials. Disinfectants for hands, instruments and surfaces also contribute to ensure complete asepsis and antisepsis in the operating room.

subcategories.description: Peha® -instrument are single-use instruments made of matt brushed, high-quality stainless steel. They are processed in the EU and offer similar characteristics as multi-use instruments in terms of intended performance, haptics and design.

subcategories.name: PREVENTIA
subcategories.description: PREVENTIA

subcategories.name: Disinfection and Hygiene
subcategories.description: With products from the subsidiary BODE Chemie, HARTMANN offers its health care and industry customers a comprehensive range of disinfectants and hygiene products. They protect staff, patients and others from infection and contamination.

subcategories.name: Skin
subcategories.description: Any medical procedure penetrating the skin’s protective barrier – for example, punctures, injections, placement of catheters or surgical procedures – carries the risk of infection.

subcategories.name: Instruments
subcategories.description: More than ever, instrument reprocessing has to cope with a demanding task. Our products are developed in accordance with scientific findings and legal requirements.

subcategories.name: Surface
subcategories.description: Cost effectiveness and material compatibility play a major role in surface hygiene. More than this, our products offer rapid and broad activity and high convenience.

subcategories.name: Equipment
subcategories.description:
The availability of hand disinfectants is one basic requirement of hand disinfection. Key factors include the number of dispensers and their correct placement. Dispensers ensure the availability of
hand disinfectants, their hygienic dispensing and correct application.

subcategories.name: Hands
subcategories.description:
Hands are the number one risk in transmitting healthcare-associated infections. Therefore, HARTMANN particularly focuses on hand hygiene – through intensive research and continuous,
consistent product advancement.

subcategories.name: Incontinence Management
subcategories.description: About one out of five people over 40 is affected by bladder weakness or incontinence. There are treatments available, but nevertheless lots of people suffer as needed advise is often not given and the adequate remedies are often not known. While using absorbent incontinence products, a lot of quality of life can be given back to people affected. With incontinence products from HARTMANN, nursing staff and patients can be sure that they are using high quality disposable products customized to individual needs. They provide secure leakage protection, protect skin from irritation, ensure a high wearing comfort and are easy to use.

subcategories.name: All-in-one Incontinence Briefs
subcategories.description: MoliCare® Premium Elastic and Slip all-in-one briefs are designed for managing urinary and faecal incontinence. They provide all-round leakage protection, a secure and ergonomic fit, and exceptional comfort. Made with pH-balanced, skin-friendly materials, these products offer reliable performance and care. (Moderate to Severe Incontinence)

products.description:
The already comprehensive MoliCare Premium Mobile range with pants that are worn instead of underwear, now has been extended to include the unique MoliCare Premium Mobile 10 Drops Day & Night: with an anatomical shaped absorbent core for quick urine absorption and optimal protection any time.

The high-performance triple-layer absorbent core absorbs even larger volumes of liquid and guides it into the inner part to enclose urine securely and keeps the skin dry for up to 12 hours. In the process unpleasant odours are neutralised for enhanced wellbeing. The dermatologically tested and latex-free product provides optimal protection for Day and Night.

products.assortmentProductApplication:
MoliCare® premium lady Pad 1 drop incontinence pads are up to 29 % thinner than before for extra discretion.

How to use MoliCare® premium lady Pad 1 drop:

  • ​Ensure intimate area is clean and dry.
  • Open the individually wrapped pad with the release tape.
  • Unfold the pad completely and remove wrapping foil.
  • Place the pad adhesive-side down in the centre of underwear and press down to secure.
  • After use, remove and dispose of pad in regular waste.
  • Do not flush pad or packaging.

products.assortmentProductApplication:
MoliCare® MEN Absorbent underwear are washable male incontinence pants with a hidden pocket for the use of MoliCare® X-Change Pads, for added protection.

How to apply pads and care for the underwear:

  • Fold pad lengthwise and insert in pocket.
  • Adjust pad so it lies flat.
  • Replace pad as needed to stay fresh and dry.
  • Remove pad before washing underwear.
  • Hygienically wash underwear at 60 °C. To ensure underwear maintains its functionality, use a mild detergent. Do not use fabric softeners.

MoliCare® lady Absorbent underwear are reuseable period underwear for both menstrual and incontinence care, suitable for very light bladder weakness.


Following these steps will keep the underwear fresh, clean and ready to wear:  


•    Wash before first use

subcategories.name: Diagnostics
subcategories.description:
Who doesn't want to stay fit and active until old age? The increasing role of preventive health care shows, that people are aware of and want to avoid complications and long-term consequences. Therefore the regular monitoring of measured body values is becoming more and more important.

That's why we naturally reach for the fever thermometer when we are not feeling well because of a cold, that to say when we are suffering from symptoms of a cold. Regarding hypertension this is different. Hypertension can be seen as an "asymptomatic" desease because the consequences can physically not be perceived.

As a result, it is important to recognize hypertension in an early stage, start the right therapy and control the blood pressure on a regularly basis. If you want to improve your personal health care, our diagnostic products help to control the important body values comfortably and reliably.

products.description:
For quick temperature readings in the ear and on the forehead 

With the Veroval® 2 in 1 infrared thermometer for the whole family* you can measure the temperature easily in the ear or on the forehead – whichever you prefer. For smooth, safe and hygienic ear measurement, the device comes with 10 single-use protective covers. Refill packs of 20 can be purchased at pharmacies or medical supply stores. 

* adults and children from 6 months old 

Thanks to the infrared technology, measurements with the Veroval® 2 in 1 thermometer are fast. The measuring sensor detects the infrared radiation emanating from the eardrum or the forehead surface and produces the result during an ear measurement in one second. 

Fast – thanks to infrared technology

The measuring sensor detects the infrared radiation emanating from the eardrum or the frontal surface and reproduces the measurement result during the ear measurement in one second. For forehead measurement, the highest recognized measurement value is displayed after completion of the scanning process.

Readings in the ear

The reading can be carried out in the right or left ear. The thermometer measures the infrared rays emitted by the eardrum and the ear canal. These rays are collected by the sensor and converted into temperature values. The best results are obtained when the infrared rays are collected from the middle ear (eardrum). Rays emitted by surrounding tissue give lower readings. Moreover, to ensure hygienic temperature taking in the ear, the original Veroval® PC22 – protective covers should always be used.

Readings on the forehead

The thermometer measures the infrared rays emitted by the skin in the area of the forehead and temples and the surrounding tissue. The rays are collected by the sensors and converted into temperature values. The most accurate values are obtained by scanning the entire area from temple to temple.

subcategories.name: Wound Management
subcategories.description:
When it comes to the welfare of the people, ideas are needed. Our ideas for the benefit of people have over a 100-year tradition in the treatment of wounds, as well as their implementation in routine medical practice.

In the last decade, research has opened many new perspectives in the treatment of wounds. The usage of modern wound dressings goes far beyond the traditional functions of the cover and/or absorption of wound exudate. With modern products, therapeutic effects can be achieved based on different modes of action. They actively engage in the processes of wound healing and support the natural physiological process. Their high therapeutic benefits, especially in the treatment of poorly healing wounds, are of great importance.

Negative pressure therapy is a further effective therapy method providing a wide range of uses and increasingly gaining in importance not only in hospitals but also in the out-patient sector. Thanks to our high medical competence, we are in a position to offer an innovative and easy-to-use system in this field, too, which is completing our overall product range in an excellent way.

Thus, we are a competent provider of wound dressings, from the classical wound treatment to post-operative dressings, dressings and bandages for dressing retention, sets, compression bandages, hydroactive wound dressing and last but not least negative pressure wound therapy.

products.assortmentProductDescription: The wound-facing surface of the dressing has a mesh structure and is impregnated with a hydrogel that acts as a moisture reservoir. The gel consists of a hydrated polyurea/polyurethane hybrid polymer containing propylene glycol. The gel on the side of the wound-contact layer prevents the dressing from sticking to the wound. products.assortmentProductApplication: HydroClean® is suitable for wet/moist treatment of wounds, in particular of wounds with impaired healing tendency. The product is especially suitable for the treatment of chronic and poorly healing wounds during the cleansing and granulation stage. HydroClean® can also be used for the treatment of infected wounds. HydroClean® can furthermore be used to reactivate stagnating healing processes if these are caused by excessive MMP activity.
products.assortmentProductClaim: The interactive wound pad with the Rinsing-Absorption-Mechanism.
products.assortmentProductDescription: HydroClean® delivers Ringer’s solution to the wound for up to three days. During this time, interactive and continuous wound irrigation takes place, due to the wound dressing pad also absorbing wound exudate. The SAP used in HydroClean® inactivates matrix metalloproteinases (MMP) which impair wound healing. As a result, stagnating healing in chronic wounds can be reactivated.
products.description: HydroClean® delivers Ringer’s solution to the wound for up to three days. During this time, interactive and continuous wound irrigation takes place because the wound dressing pad also absorbs wound exudate.

products.assortmentProductDescription: The dressing can release moisture and absorb a limited amount of exudate, thereby providing a moist wound environment which has a stimulating effect on wound healing, because of the high water content of approx. 60%. products.assortmentProductApplication:
Take the Atrauman® Ag from the peel pack with both cover papers in place and, if necessary, cut it so that it fits the size of the wound by applying sterile conditions. Atrauman® Ag should overlap the wound and should be about the same size as the secondary dressing. Remove the cover paper on one side. Either place the free side on the wound and then remove the remaining cover paper (see pictograms 1 – 5) or use sterile tweezers or sterile gloves to pick up Atrauman® Ag from the second cover paper and place it on the wound (see pictograms a-f). Atrauman® Ag should be applied in a single layer, do not fold or apply in multiple layers. Secure a suitable sterile, secondary dressing (either absorbent or superabsorbent dressings, foam dressings or gauzes e.g. Zetuvit® Plus) according to its use instructions over Atrauman® Ag to absorb wound exudate. As an alternative, the Vivano negative pressure wound therapy system can be used. In particular, in the case of deep wounds, it must be ensured, that Atrauman® Ag is in direct contact with the absorbent wound dressing so that no creasing occurs in order to guarantee unimpaired drainage of exudate. In the case of thick exudate, it is recommended to cut in Atrauman Ag with sterile scissors to prevent accumulation of exudate. Please observe the related instructions for use before combining the dressing with the Vivano negative
pressure wound therapy system. The efficacy of the barrier dressing lasts for up to seven days. Unless otherwise prescribed by the doctor or medically indicated, a new Atrauman® Ag dressing should be applied at each dressing change. The wear time of one dressing shall not exceed seven days.
products.assortmentProductClaim:
Atrauman® Ag is thin, soft and can be cut into size and is drapable.
Atrauman® Ag ensures close contact with the whole surface of the wound.
Atrauman® Ag supports painless dressing change by minimizing adhesion to wounds.
products.assortmentProductDescription:
Atrauman® Ag is a non-adherent wound contact layer suitable for the treatment of chronic wounds, such as ulcus cruris, diabetic leg ulcer and decubitus. It is also suitable for the treatment of acute burns up to 2nd degree. Atrauman® Ag is suitable for the treatment on the human skin by professional users.
Support fabric made of polyamide fibres coated with elemental silver. The impregnation is non-medicated and triglyceride based (neutral lipids). The impregnation contains (INCI assigned names): Caprylic/Capric/Myristik/Stearic Triglyceride; Bis-diglycerylpolyacyladipate-2 and Macrogol 2000.
The soft, thin support fabric drapes easily and ensures close contact with the wound base. The fabric’s surface and the impregnation counteract adhesion to the wound; as a result, the dressing supports atraumatic dressing changes. Atrauman® Ag acts as a silver-containing barrier dressing. The impregnation protects the wound edges helping to prevent maceration, it is non-medicated, contains no paraffin.
products.description: Atrauman® Ag is a non-adherent silver-containing barrier dressing for atraumatic wound treatment.
products.name: Atrauman® Ag

products.assortmentProductApplication: Take the dressing out of the peel pack with both product covers in place and, if needed, cut it with sterile scissors to the size of the wound. After removal of one of the product covers, place this side of the dressing onto the wound and remove the second cover. Place a sterile, absorbent dressing pad over the Atrauman dressing to absorb exudate. Unless otherwise prescribed by the physician or another healthcare professional, apply a new Atrauman® dressing at each dressing change. The wear time of the dressing depends on the condition of the wound and the level of exudate. Note: If there are therapeutic reasons for not changing the dressing, the ointment may be absorbed when left in place for a longer period of time. In this case possible wound adhesion which may occur can be eliminated by placing a second Atrauman® dressing over the first one.
products.assortmentProductClaim:
Atrauman® is thin, soft, can be cut into size and is drapable. Atrauman® allows close contact with the whole surface of the wound.
Atrauman® allows atraumatic and almost painless dressing changes.
products.assortmentProductDescription: Atrauman® are single-use, sterile, non-medicated ointment dressings suitable for the treatment of superficial acute and chronic wounds of any type. As a non-adherent wound contact layer, it is particularly suitable for preventing the secondary dressing from sticking to the wound bed and for keeping wound edges and surrounding skin supple. Due to the neutral properties of the non-medicated ointment mass, Atrauman® is especially useful in dermatology as well as for patients with sensitive skin and those sensitive to certain medications. Atrauman® are single-use, sterile, non-medicated ointment dressings suitable for the treatment of superficial acute and chronic wounds of any type. As a non-adherent wound contact layer, it is particularly suitable for preventing the secondary dressing from sticking to the wound bed and for keeping wound edges and surrounding skin supple. Due to the neutral properties of the non-medicated ointment mass, Atrauman® is especially useful in dermatology as well as for patients with sensitive skin and those sensitive to certain medications.

treatment.

subcategories.name: Absorption Pads
subcategories.description: Absorbent dressings for medium to high levels of exudate. Versions with silicone borders area available

products.assortmentProductApplication:
• Clean the wound using a physiological solution or as instructed by a clinician.
• Select a suitable dressing size and shape for the wound, ensuring that the green absorbent pad exceeds the wound margins by approx. 1 to 2 cm. Do not cut the green absorbent pad. The transparent border can be cut to adapt the dressing to specific body areas, for example into a concave shape.
• Before applying the dressing, after rinsing the wound, make sure that the surrounding skin is dry to ensure that the dressing adheres.
• Remove both protective sheets. Place the adherent side of the dressing onto the wound, so that the green side faces away from the wound.
• Press down the adhesive edges firmly and avoid wrinkles in the border to ensure the dressing stays securely in place.
• No additional fixation is required. If indicated, compression bandages can be applied as instructed by a clinician.
• The dressing can remain on the wound for up to 7 days, depending on the condition of the wound and the established clinical protocol.
• The dressing must be changed if clinically indicated or when exudate reaches the rim of the green absorbent pad.
products.assortmentProductClaim: The adhesive SAP wound dressing with silicone wound contact layer.
products.assortmentProductDescription:
Zetuvit® Plus Silicone Border is a SAP wound dressing for the treatment of acute and chronic wounds with moderate to high levels of exudate. It absorbs exudate containing bacteria and proteases and binds it in the absorbent core. A moist wound environment is maintained in the process. Zetuvit® Plus Silicone Border is equipped with a silicone wound contact layer that enables a low-pain, atraumatic dressing change. Due to the reliably adhering silicone adhesive border, additional fixation is not necessary. Zetuvit® Plus Silicone Border is waterproof and protects against secondary infections with bacteria and viruses. 

Zetuvit® Plus Silicone Border can be used in context of compression therapy.
products.description: Zetuvit® Plus Silicone Border is a self-adhesive, easy-to-use and soft superabsorbent SAP wound dressing with silicone wound contact layer for the treatment of moderately to heavily exuding, chronic and acute wounds.

products.assortmentProductApplication:
•Clean the wound using a physiological solution or as instructed by a clinician.
•Select a suitable dressing size for the wound making sure that the dressing overlaps the margins of the wound by approx. 1 – 2 cm. Do not cut the dressing.
•Before applying the dressing, after rinsing the wound, make sure that the area around the wound is dry using swabs to ensure that the dressing adheres.
•Remove the protective sheets. Place the dressing with the adherent side onto the wound, so that the green side faces away from the wound.
•Secure the dressing using e.g. a Peha-haft bandage or any other suitable fixation, or, if need be, with compression bandages as instructed by a clinician.
•A dressing can remain on the wound for up to 5 days, depending on the condition of the wound and the established clinical protocol. The dressing must be changed if clinically indicated or when exudate reaches the rim of the dressing.
products.assortmentProductClaim: The silicone layer in contact with the wound allows easy application and almost painless, atraumatic removal. The absorbent pad absorbs and retains the exudate.
products.assortmentProductDescription: Zetuvit® Plus Silicone is a single use sterile superabsorbent dressing with a silicone interface for long-term treatment of injured skin, acute and chronic wounds, with moderate to high levels of exudate. It is used on adults only, by healthcare professionals in clinical or homecare environments and can be combined with local antiseptics, primary and secondary dressings and under compression.
products.description: Zetuvit® Plus Silicone is a sterile dressing for the treatment of moderately to highly exuding, acute and chronic wounds. The silicone layer in contact with the wound allows easy application and almost painless, atraumatic removal. The absorbent pad absorbs and retains the exudate.

products.assortmentProductApplication: Suitable for the treatment of superficial, moderately to severely exuding acute wounds (traumatic wounds, post-operative wounds, lymphatic wounds, arterial leg ulcers) and chronic wounds (decubitus/pressure sores, venous or mixed leg ulcers, tumour wounds).

Very high absorption capacity thanks to its highly absorbent core.
The side facing away from the wound offers an optimal clothing and bedding protection.

products.assortmentProductDescription: Zetuvit® Plus is a combined superabsorbent dressing which consists of four layers of different materials. On the wound side, the product features a soft, white, hydrophilic nonwoven (viscose and polyamide). The inner dressing core consists of soft cellulose fluff blended with liquid-retaining polyacrylate polymers. This absorbent core is enclosed in a thin nonwoven fabric that evenly distributes the liquid. On the side facing away from the wound, the product features a green layer of polypropylene nonwoven, which is water-repellent but permeable to air and allows for gas exchange.
products.description: Zetuvit® Plus is a sterile superabsorbent dressing used on superficial, moderately to severely exuding wounds. The absorbent core absorbs and binds exudate.

media.mediaDescription: Due to its high absorbency core; Zetuvit Plus absorbs much more than conventional absorbent dressings. Wound exudate is taken up quickly and safely retained in the absorbent core.

subcategories.description: The Vivano System is a medical device family designed for advance wound care based on negative pressure wound therapy (NPWT) to be used in patients to facilitate an optimal environment for wound healing.

products.assortmentProductApplication: Ergonomic design and a 3-easy step starting system ensure the highest operating comfort. Together with a non-disturbing noise (patent application pending) & automatic day/night mode with adjusted display brightness patient comfort is ensured. The sleek NPWT unit is small, light-weight and robust making it suitable for both stationary and mobile use. Powerful, high-quality technology ensures long-lasting, reliable operation.
products.assortmentProductClaim: Negative pressure wound therapy system
products.assortmentProductDescription: VivanoTec Pro is lightweight and compact, making it suitable for stationary as well as mobile use. The VivanoTec Pro negative pressure wound therapy unit can be used for different types of wounds (chronic, acute wounds). The negative pressure therapy ensures the safe removal of the wound exudate and the promotion of wound healing, stimulating cell growth and blood circulation in the wound.

subcategories.name: Mediset
subcategories.description:
Out of 100 hospitalized patients, 5 will acquire at least one hospital acquired infection: HAI are a major issue in hospital (European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control). About them, surgery and OR come often in mind. However, care procedures outside OR play a central role, they represent million and million of procedures per year and are a critical moment for infection spreading.

MediSet® is the brand of disposable care sets by HARTMANN. These sets are used to carry out treatment steps according to a set procedure.
MediSet® procedure sets are at the core of care procedure in wards and has an important contribution to make in preventing infections.
MediSet® Sterile single use sets contain the necessary components, in the right order, to allow healthcare professionals to perform a given care procedure in compliance with asepsis requirements.

MediSet® empowers healthcare professionals to provide better care for their patients with single-use care procedure sets that effectively combine convenience and risk prevention – allowing for maximum safety and efficiency in care procedures.

subcategories.name: Feminine Hygiene
subcategories.description:
In line with our tradition of operating in the field of medical and hygiene products we have successfully offered feminine hygiene products for many years now. To fulfil the increasing and manigfold requirements, these products are steadily developed further. So, today it is totally logical that, for example, panty shields have a perfectly body-shaped cut, are user friendly and offer safe protection. However, what is more important in this context is the choice of materials in manufacture, in particular, when it concerns the direct contact with the skin. Because such products they have to be soft and pleasant to the touch, but also skin-friendly, reliable and safe at the same time.

These requirements are met with our range of feminine hygiene products in a variety of presentations. Thus, it is ensured that always the right product is at hand together with the highest skin comfort and maximum safety.

subcategories.name: Patient Care
subcategories.description:
To provide qualified patient care is not only a question of skill and motivation of the caregivers, but also requires adequate aids. Therefore, HARTMANN offers a comprehensive range of products for medical patient care which make work easier and more efficient.

Beyond being a mere supplier of products, HARTMANN also wants to transmit specialist knowledge. Because there are many nursing care methods which have proven to be effective in hospitals and nursing homes, that are worth being advised for the provision of efficient care for dependent people in the domestic environment.

subcategories.name: Personal and Patient Hygiene
subcategories.description: Ensure hygiene and patient care with our range of disposable products, including gloves, wipes, towels, blankets, and aprons. We provide reliable solutions for hygienic care, laundry protection, and maintaining comfort.

subcategories.name: Other Nursing Care Products
subcategories.description: Peha-Fresh® provides bleached or unbleached cellulose wadding, ideal for absorbency and padding. With high absorbency, it’s available in rolls or layers, offering effective, reliable protection for various needs.

subcategories.name: Maternity Products
subcategories.description: Samu® offers reliable protection with soft, skin-friendly products for postpartum care. Dermatologically tested, it ensures fast fluid absorption and features soft, textile-like top sheets for enhanced comfort.

subcategories.name: Examination Gloves
subcategories.description: Peha-Soft® provides caregivers reliable protection against pathogens and viruses. Latex-free, powder-free, and free from type 1 allergens, it’s certified as a Medical Device and PPE category 2, ensuring uncompromising quality.

subcategories.name: First Aid
subcategories.description: First Aid is mostly performed by amateurs. In an emergency situation it is not always easy to keep a cool head and do the right thing. Therefore, it is even more important that appropriate first aid material is handy. The first aid kit in the car, the well equipped house pharmacy, a small first aid kit for travel, hiking or playing sports can suddenly become very important.

subcategories.name: Cotton Wool and Cosmetic Products
subcategories.description:
All cotton wool is not the same when it comes to properties, which can differ considerably depending on the composition, be it cotton, cellulose or a blend of both. The resulting different characteristics can purposely be created in such a way that they satisfy the specific demands that can be placed on cotton wool products.

Originally designed for medical purposes only, the application of cotton wool has undergone substantial changes over time, whereas cotton wool is now mainly used for cosmetics and hygiene purposes. In its various different presentations, such as cotton buds, pre-formed balls and pads or folded in pleats, cotton wool has become a familiar aid in daily hygiene.
